pageContext.claim: “My letter was a response to their letter. The media forgot that. You know, the media said, 'Oh, you had a meeting, then you cancelled.' I didn't cancel the meeting. I cancelled it in response to a very tough statement. And I think we're over that -- totally over that.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a confusing claim, as there are no degrees of cancellation. You either cancel something or you don't. Trump had canceled his meeting with Kim Jong Un before he rescheduled it. In a May 24 letter to Kim, Trump wrote: "I feel it is inappropriate, at this time, to have this long-planned meeting. Therefore, please let this letter serve to represent that the Singapore summit, for the good of both parties, but to the detriment of the world, will not take place."
